intro: Henckelia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in spring and summer. Henckelia lanceolata is well adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands and sandy soils.
